alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 6:17PM EDT until July 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Morris County in northern New Jersey... Southern Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... Northeastern Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 617 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pellettown to Flatbrookville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Newton, Hopatcong, Butler, Franklin, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Branchville, Andover, Flatbrookville, Lake Mohawk, Greendell, Millbrook, Five Points, Pellettown, Green Pond and Crandon Lakes. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
